title: What are some truths which are unproven scientifically? - Quora

response.answer_text: Everything  Richard Feynman, about why asking “Why” will always land you in “I don’t know” Look at any phenomena in the world and tell me how it works. You will tell me “Well it works this way, because of X”. I will ask you you “Why X? How does X work?” And you will tell me “Well X works because of Y”. And I will ask you “Why Y? How does Y work?” …and so on. Like a petulant child I will keep asking “Why?”, and you will keep answering “Because…” …until you cannot do it any more, because you simply do not know. For example… Why do children looks like their parents?Because they inherit traits.Why do they inherit traits?Because genes and DNA.Why genes and DNA?Because all life has that.How did life come to have have DNA?We do not know. Every chain of “Why - Because - Why” ends in “I do not know”. Knowledge is bounded in all directions such that when you reach that boundary, you have to answer “I do not know”. The job of science is to move that boundary so deep, that when someone asks “Why”, they will — eventually — get an answer that makes them say “Ok, that is good enough for me, thank you”.
